#include "eval.hpp"

 Evaluate operator +.Error if an operand is not of type int or double.
Cell * eval_ceiling (Cell *const c)
 Evaluate operator ceiling.Error if the operand is not of type double or more than one operands are passed in.
Cell * eval (Cell *const c)
 Evaluate the expression tree whose root is pointed to by c (error if c does not hold a well-formed expression).

Detailed Description

Evaluate the s-expression tree parsed by parse.cpp.Handle three operator + if and ceiling and do error detection.

Function Documentation

Cell* eval ( Cell *const   c  ) 

Evaluate the expression tree whose root is pointed to by c (error if c does not hold a well-formed expression).

Returns:
The value resulting from evaluating the expression.

Cell * eval_addition ( Cell *  operand_list  ) 

Evaluate operator +.Error if an operand is not of type int or double.

Parameters:
operand_list The root of the subtree following the + symbol.
Returns:
the summation of the operand_list.

Cell * eval_ceiling ( Cell *const   c  ) 

Evaluate operator ceiling.Error if the operand is not of type double or more than one operands are passed in.

Parameters:
c The root of the subtree following the ceiling symbol.
Returns:
The smallest integer that is greater or equal to the operand.

Cell * eval_if ( Cell *const   c  ) 

Evaluate operator if.Error if there is too few operands or there are too many operands.

Parameters:
c The root of the subtree following the if symbol.
Returns:
the value of the second expression if the first one evaluates to non-zero value, otherwise return the value of the third expression if there is a third expression, or undefined if there isn't any.
